p.d: After jazz reached Istanbul, it firmly took root there. Quite a few jazz bars have sprung up to cater to the genre's fans. The DJAZZ series 'Istanbul Sessions' is the thermometer of Istanbul jazz in the first decade of the 2000s. The concerts featured in this series were recorded at several Istanbul jazz clubs, featuring some of the very best and freshest jazz bands. The series offers an eye-witness account of the incredible inventiveness and diversity of Istanbul's jazz scene. In this broadcast, Arkin Allen, also known as Mercan Dede, performs at the Borusan Müzik Evi. This Turkish musician and DJ combines the Sufi tradition with electronic music. This perfect symbiosis between Ottoman tradition and western modernity yields fantastic music played on a wide variety of extraordinary instruments.
